definition[0]: to hit your hands against each other many times to make a sound that shows your approval, agreement, or enjoyment
example[0]: One man began to clap, and others joined in.
example[1]: The couple were cheered and clapped on their arrival.
example[2]: The audience clapped politely but without much enthusiasm.
definition[1]: if you clap your hands, you hit your hands together a few times to attract someone’s attention or to show that you are pleased
example[3]: Narouz clapped his hands and a servant entered.
example[4]: Mandy laughed and clapped her hands in delight.
definition[2]: to put your hand on something quickly and firmly
example[5]: ‘Mick!’ She clapped her hand over her mouth. ‘I’d forgotten!’
example[6]: Ben grinned and clapped me amiably on the shoulder.
definition[3]: the loud sound that you make when you hit your hands together many times to show that you enjoyed something
example[7]: Come on everyone, let’s give Tommy a clap.
